Content: The Tethys System recently expanded its frequency feature library and detected a previously unknown, special frequency. In response, the Black Shores dispatched Bloom Bearers to investigate. Valentina informs you that Shorekeeper is now analyzing the abnormal frequency and suggests you meet her for more information.
Group A, begin data preprocessing. Group B, deploy ground interference neutralizers... Oh, {PlayerName}, you're here.
Why is there such a large gathering today?

The Black Shores recovered the Threnodian's Gem not long ago... I mean, Leviathan's essence. The Tethys System ran a deep analysis and expanded its frequency feature library. This enhancement allows us to detect previously unidentifiable special frequencies.

Bloom Bearers not assigned to critical duties have been dispatched to investigate. The Shorekeeper is also dedicating part of her computations to tracking it. The Black Shores has classified this as a high-priority operation and is committing additional resources to track and replicate the signal.
That explains the crowd.
Exactly. None of us can identify this abnormal frequency, so it might lead to new discoveries.
The Shorekeeper is in the Error Cell. You can go there to speak with her.
Fortunately, not all these frequencies are Leviathan-related, so there's no immediate risk of Its revival. That said, the closest anomaly is right offshore.
Watch out!
You... you're the one from before.
This area isn't safe. When the Tacet Discords become crystallized, they become harder to handle... Get down!
The Lament is looping. We need to get out of here first.
You said the Lament is "looping"...? So this has happened before?
Yes. It's like a pair of scissors... slicing Honami City into hopeless, broken pieces.
...Just like what you're seeing now.
What's happening?
They've overlapped from the distortion. Stay close.

As minutes pass, the Lament continues to devastate the city. Tacet Discords run rampant, and the city crumbles around you. With no time to spare, you and the mysterious scissor-wielding girl retreat toward a safe zone.
Chisa! Over here! Over here!
Drop the loot and follow it!
The next Slice is almost here. I know you have a lot of questions, but hold onto them for now. Just follow me.
You're injured.
My apologies. I just had to be sure you hadn't turned into one of them.
The safe house is just ahead. Come with me.
(Steady breathing... No signs of Irideglow crystallization. I can rule out the possibility {Male=he;Female=she}'s one of the Left Behind.)
(She's the one who came at me when I first dropped into this Sonoro.)
(So why did she save me this time? And even...)
Hm? It's fine. Just scratches. That won't slow me down.

In the safe zone, you and the girl catch your breath. You lean against a wall to steady yourself while she watches you in silence. You meet her gaze, yet her eyes seem to focus just off to the side, leaving you uncertain what she's looking at.
We've arrived. The brawl has ended. Breeze slips through the shutters. Coffee stain dries slow.
Oh, a Passenger. Welcome aboard.
Thank you.
You're welcome. Like I said, I'm sure you have a lot of questions. But first, please allow us to introduce ourselves.
Ah Chisa, so formal, as usual. I think {Male=he;Female=she} looks like a good person.
...Then you can handle the introductions.
Greetings, Passenger. My name is Namipon, the <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano> of Honami. I'm also the one who showed you the way... Mmm, I can tell you're a good soul.
Hello, Namipon. You're a cute one!
This capybara has a name?
Hehe, new friends knock like a spring breeze... Oh, I mean, I'm happy you find me cute.
No, no. I'm not the kind of animal you think I am. I am this city's <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano>.
So of course I have a name. It was given by all who live here.
And this is Chisa. A strong, mysterious...
An ordinary student.
Sorry again. Things were chaotic when we first met, and I couldn't tell whether or not you were one of the Left Behind... I didn't have time to explain.
But now, I'm sure. You're just another person pulled into this.
You mean...
Can I ask how you ended up here?
(Answer honestly)
(Refuse to answer)
A rift opened up. A hand came out of it and dragged me in.
A hand from a rift? But why didn't that person escape themselves? Why pull you in instead?
What exactly is this place?
Before we go any further, I need to know where we really are.

You enter a coffeehouse, finally meeting the "mysterious capybara"—Namipon. It proudly declares itself the city's <ano=Mascot>guardian</ano> and, with great enthusiasm, introduces the girl as Chisa, "A strong, mysterious… ordinary student."
What is it? Do you have any questions for me?
Why did you choose this coffeehouse as a base?
How did you meet Namipon?
How can I leave this Sonoro?
I have nothing else to ask.
Because of its location. It's well-placed, with passageways on both sides. Ideal for monitoring movement.
When I first found it, the inside was a cluttered mess. I spent the last two months clearing it out. It's still far from tidy, but it's good enough for rest and shelter.
Has it always just been you and Namipon here?
Yes. It's always just been the two of us.

But there are still... people in the city. I call them the <ano=Human Reverberations>Left Behind</ano>. They don't realize they're already dead. Still go about their lives, heading to school, waiting for buses, replying to messages... But once they begin to notice something's wrong, their consciousness begins to crumble. Seconds later, they're gone.

That's why I don't say anything. I pretend they're just ordinary citizens. They never remember me, anyway. Sometimes I help them fix a jammed vending machine or tidy up a messy stall... not for any reason. Just because I'm there.
I don't like watching them disappear like that. It's... unsettling. Like they were never real to begin with.
Hmm, well...
After I first found this place and began setting it up, I went out to gather supplies. Then, Namipon appeared.
It knows the city's layout and transport better than anyone. It helped me a lot. But all I could offer in return were a few cups of coffee and some desserts.
Seems like Namipon is easy to please.
Didn't expect Namipon to know so much.
It's an interesting creature. And...
And?
And I think it's even more attached to Honami than I am.
Attached...?
If that interests you, talk to it. I'm sure Namipon would be happy to chat. It was practically humming the whole time on its way to pick you up.

I've been looking for an opening. Based on what I've observed, Neon Tower in the center of the city is most likely the key. The frequency there is highly unstable, and it shows the Lament's most severe spatial fracturing. Could be the source... or maybe the endpoint.
But I can't get close. The space in Honami is twisted and overlapping. I've tried every method I could think of, but I always end up looping back to the same spot.
...Now it's just me. And things don't always go the way I want them to.
I have nothing else to ask.
Why not walk around the coffeehouse and relax a bit? We've still got time before the next Lament hits.
Has the coffeehouse always had this much stuff in it?
No, not at first. I brought most of it in myself over the past two months.

I didn't focus on decorations. Durable and low power, that's what mattered. Like that coffee machine over there. It was half broken, but the inner heating pipe still worked. I modified it. Good for a cup of coffee now, at least.
Also rearranged the power grid. Added voltage regulator stabilizers. It may be cobbled together... but it's stronger. Should be able to handle a sudden blackout now.
...Oh, sorry. Rambled on there. You might not be interested in such things.
It wasn't always like this. There used to be someone else. They caught the misaligned pieces, pointed out the right routes. I made sense of it all... because I had another mind with me.
This sofa has seen some years, but somebody's taken good care of it.
That little dip on the left side. Hmm... kinda looks like a capybara butt.
I guess Namipon really likes this spot.
The plastic casing's gone a bit yellow. Some scratches here and there, but the drip tray's spotless.
The "Espresso" button is too worn to read, but the milk frother knob still looks new. Looks like someone's got a clear taste preference.
*Light, upbeat melody*
Good afternoon, everyone. You're listening to the city radio, drifting gently beneath the early summer sun. Now for your daily dose of happiness—

A hundred blind picnic baskets have been scattered across the lush lawns of Central Park by City Hall! Each one holds a surprise: maybe a hand-brewed coffee kit paired with a poetry book, or a handcrafted picnic bag for two sweethearts.
A friendly cleaner even let slip that someone found open-air concert tickets tucked in a flowerbed this morning!

Meanwhile, the Geiei Gallery Summer Exhibit is in full swing at Hanakage Underground Street. Rare vintage video tapes are on display, inviting you to take a slow stroll through the long river of history.
And don't forget: today's bus stop announcements are hiding snippets of the song "Melody in the Rainbow." The passenger who finds the most will win this month's city tram pass!
Keep your heart tuned to joy, and may your day in Honami be a beautiful one.
*A soft outro melody plays*
Umm... Hello, Passenger.
No rush. You can finish your Rice Dango first.
Mmm... f-finished. How considerate.
Is there anything I can help you with, Passenger?
I want to learn about this city.
I want to learn about you.
Ah, Honami City... It's a good place.
I like it here. Flowers drift by the riverside. A tunnel glows with rainbow light. Even though some of it has changed, I...
I'm still... fond of it. It's like every time I open my eyes, I already know what the view will be.
Hmm... I don't remember how I "woke up." One day, I just knew this city like the lines of my paw.
Perhaps they created me? All those people in this city, they built things, opened shops, and lived their lives... In the end, all those little pieces came together. And out came me.
If you think of it that way, maybe I'm just a strange dream they all had together. Or maybe even... a ghost? Hehe.
Me? I'm Namipon! A little critter wandering the city, patching things up here and there. I can help you find your way, too.
I know every alley and corner of Honami like the back of my paw. I'll be a good travel buddy. All I ask for is a cup of coffee or a Rice Dango. Well... it's also okay if you don't have anything.
I'll still help. Because helping you means helping everyone in Honami.
Say, Passenger... will you bring us a new story? Chisa's been stuck in this loop for two whole months. You're the only change we've seen.
That's why... I feel like you might open a new path.
Ah, but don't worry. If I am a ghost, I'm a nice one. After all, the people who once lived in Honami loved it dearly. Whatever they left behind... must be gentle, too.
I'm really looking forward to our journey ahead.
Greetings, <ano=Master>Goshujin-sama</ano>. Is there anything I can do to make your day brighter?
Are you... a butler?
You look just like Namipon!
I'd love to try.
Here you go! Careful, it's hot. If the sweetness isn't just right, just let me know, okay?
That's because I am a Namipon! We're all the same Namipon you know. Just shaped a little differently by people's wishes. But deep down, we're all one and the same.
So, how about a hot cup of our freshly brewed house special?
Yes! I manage everything in <ano=Train Conductor>Shashou</ano> Cafe! Would you care for a hot cup of our freshly brewed house special?
Greetings, Passenger! You're just in time! Ta-da! Take this, your very own Namipon Badge!
What is it?
Why are you giving this to me?
It's something special. Since you're new here, it's only right I lend a hand. Whether you're in trouble or just need to rest your feet, come find me anytime, alright?
So, what do you say? Want to hear more about this badge?
Go on!
But don't worry. You're safe here.
This <ano=Shashou Cafe>coffeehouse</ano> is a safe zone I created using my "clipping" Forte. The location is ideal and the space stable, so I made it our base of operations.
Your "clipping" Forte?
Everything has a structure. And with these, I can see how it all fits together.
When I was in the center of the city right before the Lament hit?
For the past two months, I've lived through countless repeats of the Lament. Time and space keep getting sliced up and rearranged. What you see now—that chaos—is the result.
It's like the whole city's trapped in amber. The people here are caught in one moment, reliving the same day over and over.
I suspect they're no longer truly alive. Just... residual Reverberations. I call them the <te href=851065>Left Behind</te>.
How long has this been going on?
I wish I knew. Like you, I'm not from here. I was pulled in by the Lament and trapped in this unfamiliar city.
By objective measurement, I've been trapped in Honami for two months. But even when I first arrived, this endless loop was already underway.
So you've only tracked the last two months. To get the full picture, I'll need to talk to someone who's been here longer...
You're barking up the wrong capybara, Passenger. It's true I'm the guardian of Honami... but by the time I woke up, the city was already like this.
That's right. I asked Namipon before. It doesn't know more about this than us.

But here's what we do know: After the Lament, Namipon gained a physical form and a will of its own. And as Honami's mascot, it knows the city like the back of its paw. The layout, the pathways. I believe that makes it a pretty reliable partner.
And apparently... it's made itself right at home.
Mind if I take a look around?
Go ahead.
Inside this Sonoro, time and space are brittle. With enough Resonance Energy, I can trace their "threads" and cut through them.
You're in Honami. A city that was destroyed decades ago. You'll still see its name on bus stop signs, in street ads, and in local textbooks for kids.

Remember that tall tower? The one in the center of the city? That was <te href=851064>Neon Tower</te>, Honami's tallest communication facility. I once saw a billboard for a radio show there: "Voices in the Morning, broadcast citywide from Neon Tower."

But its last broadcast wasn't a morning greeting. It was the Lament. Records show that on the day of the disaster, it came pouring out of Neon Tower, wiping Honami off Solaris entirely... and sealing it inside this Sonoro.
That's what I did earlier. I cut through the gaps in space to bring you close to the base.

Chisa and Namipon share with you the history of Honami City. Though the Lament reduced it to ruins decades ago, its lingering aftereffects also sealed the city within a Sonoro Sphere. Time here remains frozen around when the Lament struck, trapping the city in a repeating loop of its final moments. The coffeehouse where you now stand is a safe zone Chisa created using her "clipping" Forte.
An old clock... its hands are still ticking.
Someone I knew left it here. She believed time flowed strangely in this Sonoro. Used timing devices to find a loophole. So I brought it to the base.
Someone you knew? Was she... also from the outside and got pulled into this Sonoro?
You could say that. I don't know who she is exactly, but she understood this place far better than I do.

She suspected the Sonoro doesn't just loop. It also has a different inner time flow than the outside world. To test her theory, she took apart countless clocks and logged everything. Even her wristwatch was...
...Her wristwatch?
Whoever pulled me into this Sonoro wore a watch like that.

...Could it have been her? But why? If she reached you, she found a way to contact the outside. So she did figure it out... Then why didn't she leave? She was always careful. Never acted without calculating the odds.
Unless... she knew that was as far as she could go.
You said she knew a lot. Where is she now?
She's...
In the tower.
She once told me she suspected the only way to break this loop and reconnect with the real world was through the Lament's source, Neon Tower. The closer you get, the more spatial fractures you see.
...And the more dangerous it gets. But she went alone. Left only a message. Said she'd use the Tower to find others to help, and I should wait here.
And then?
She never came back.

After that, I left our previous base and came here, hoping to find her. I kept trying to reach the Tower... but every time, I failed. At the Lament's edge, space splits apart. You might feel closer, but in truth, you're not.
My "clipping" Forte works like slicing a shelter out of earthquake rubble. Slabs structured just right, just enough to hide in. But that's all it does.
It's nothing against the Lament.
Well... I used to be able to open the path to Neon Tower. But...
During the Lament, my "existence" was torn apart once, so I lost that ability. The Honami you see now looks whole, but inside it's been cut into countless tangled paths like Chisa's kirigami.
To find the right path again, we have to reconnect with the Tower. And that means—
Finding a frequency that shares its source with the Tower.
Like this! The <te href=851067>Longings</te> from Honami's <ano=Human Reverberations>Left Behind</ano>. They're what woke me up, and they'll guide us to the Tower.
No, it's not about ability! You just haven't fully learned to filter out the negative emotions while collecting.
So you collect them... with this bottle?
I'm not afraid. I just think... it's unnecessary.
Then let's move.
Hm? What?
Was it covered in moss?
Maybe she brought me here because she knew that's where you are.
You said she never acted without weighing the odds. It must've been a calculated decision. I'm here because she figured you'd need some help.
Maybe she couldn't move forward herself. Maybe she got stuck somewhere. But she didn't give up. She kept looking for a breakthrough, and I'm probably part of her plan.
You don't have to carry this alone. She might've already seen this coming, and now she's waiting for you to catch up. You're not the only one trying to solve this puzzle.
...Mine would have been better executed.
Namipon and I have been collecting them for a while. It hasn't been easy. My ability... still isn't where it needs to be. But we've managed to rule out some wrong routes. We're narrowing it down.
For some reason, these Longings resonate with the Tower, the source of the Lament. Namipon believes they can lead us to the right route faster.
Count me in. The more of us, the faster we can do this.
...Most people's abilities won't protect them from that level of emotional interference. Having you there might only—
It's not about that. She's just afraid you'll hear the voices and get sucked in too!
I'll be the judge of that. She chose to bring me here, and that means she believed I could help. Maybe it's time you believed in a new possibility too, Chisa.

Inside the coffeehouse, you notice an old clock. Chisa explains that it once belonged to "someone she knew" who was obsessed with studying the Sonoro's time patterns. As the conversation unfolds, you learn that this person used to wear a moss-covered watch, the very one on the wrist of the hand that pulled you into this place. But you learn she was last heard heading to Honami City's Neon Tower, in search of an escape. She still hasn't returned.

Within Honami City, space is repeatedly sliced apart by the Lament. According to Chisa and Namipon, the only way to navigate this fragmented maze and reach Neon Tower is to rely on the "Longings" of Honami's Left Behind. Namipon produces a bottle filled with these lingering obsessions, explaining they can resonate with the Tower and guide you closer to the truth.
Ah, Ginga Street. A good place.
Hello! Old friend!
You know this place well.
Mm. That's right. Those ad walls were once covered with my picture. And over there. Used to be claw and capsule machines... all the prizes were me.
People really loved you.
Hehe... that's why I want to bring them back. I want to bring everyone home.
Leave the collecting to me. But, uh... once we start, the frequency spikes might draw in... things. I'll leave that part to you, okay?
Just some old friends.
Leave what?
AHHHH! CHISA! PASSENGER! HELP! I CAN'T BE INTERRUPTED WHILE COLLECTING!!
...I'm hearing strange sounds.
You hear it too? Desperate voices... crying for help.
Hmm. Looks like we haven't gathered enough. Maybe we need to find somewhere with more people?
How about a bit farther ahead?
Follow this road... Mm. This used to be Honami's main shopping street. Always full of life!
During the holidays, you'd see stalls on both sides. Shoppers everywhere. You could find all sorts of treasures… like me. In all kinds of shapes.
Hm? Who's there?!
Incoming!
The Fractsidus... How did they get here?
The voices are getting louder.
Echoes of the people's Longing. When too many gather at once, it's like someone hits a replay button in your head.
It's uncomfortable. Heavy in the head. Tight in the chest. Like someone's squeezing you from the inside.
But... hold on a little longer. It passes quickly.
That's direct... Well, efficiency first.
Might as well make use of it.
They left behind some kind of... device?
Looks like Frequency Detectors. But it's rough. Like something rushed the night before a lab demo. Even the most basic Frequency Stabilizers are missing.
Chisa! Passenger! Come quick! There's a lot of... strong Longings here!
Let's meet up with Namipon first.
I'm not saying they're completely useless. Just that, performance-wise, it's not very reliable.
That's it! I'm counting on you again!
The number of Tacet Discords is increasing...
Namipon said there are lots of Longings in this area.
There used to be a Commercial District here, one of the busiest parts of the city... It must've gathered the most lingering frequencies.
Mm, I also sense so many familiar scents of the past...
These monsters... They're acting the same way as before.
When they become crystallized, they go berserk. Keep your guard up.
But what's causing it in the first place?
It's hard to say. Whatever it is... it hasn't fully shown itself yet.
But I have a guess, {PlayerName}.
That thing... it's rejecting outsiders.
It's using the Tacet Discords as blades, driving them into a frenzy to stop anyone who doesn't belong to this city.
Wow, collecting in a crowded place really is different! We've got quite the catch. Let me sort them out...
What's the matter?
Did you hear that...?
Help...
This is just my speculation, but something tells me a powerful, hidden force is behind these Tacet Discords, directing them to drive away all... outsiders.
(Under what circumstances would you want to drive away outsiders...?)
(When you see this place as your own territory... your "home.")

With the Tacet Discords cleared, Namipon excitedly checks the progress of your collected Longings. Chisa, folding away her scissor blades, shares a grim suspicion: a powerful, hidden force is commanding the Tacet Discords, driving them to expel any "existence" that does not belong to Honami City. As you consider this, a faint cry for help suddenly echoes nearby.
This way! Over here!
You can start collecting now. Oh, and, um... More troublemakers might show up...
It hurts...
Help... Please help me...
He's wounded badly. Not good, already unconscious.
If we don't get him out, he won't make it.
...Slicing has started.
Space fractures and is rearranged. Everything caught inside, people included... they're all twisted into absurd, broken shapes... until the Lament ends.
Don't worry. I'll hold the line.
This time, we face it together.
...Thank you.
The slicing is getting closer. Space will break down any moment now.
Chisa?
Is it... the Lament?!
We need to get out of here immediately.
Hold on to him. And hold onto me.

You help a wounded man to his feet, only to realize his condition is critical. As you guide him out, the Lament descends once more. Bizarre Irideglow "slices" through the visible space, creeping steadily closer. With seconds to spare, Chisa raises her scissor blades at the wall before you.
Huh? You came back real quick this time...
What just happened...
That was my... Forte.
The sales champ rustles through its pouch, pulling out some meds. You lay the young man down on the sofa and tend to his wounds.
Wow, didn't expect to see you again so soon!
Hello, hello, hello! I'm your friendly mall guide, a goldstar salesbara! Thanks for waking me up! Thought I'd come here too...
Oh, is this young man injured? Hold on. I've got some meds!
This one's the best fast-acting med I've got. Should start working soon.
Are you alright?
I'm fine.
When we first met...
You cut open space, just like today.
...I thought you'd be sent straight to this safe house. But my Forte was unstable. You ended up at the bus stop nearby.
So I asked Namipon to find you.
Mm, this Namipon is pretty dependable, huh?
Thank you. Both of you.
Hehe, no need to thank me. I'm just happy to meet you, Passenger.
Ugh...
How are you feeling?
Oh... It's you! You two saved my life... Thank you...
You're welcome. It's dangerous outside. You can sleep here tonight. We've got enough food for one more person.
Thanks... I have to get home. My grandma's there alone. She must be worried sick.
No, I promised her yesterday... I said we'd watch TV together when I got back. I can't leave her waiting there alone—
No. Not yesterday. The day before...? I... I don't know.
No. No, no. I have to go home! Someone's waiting for me! I—
...No... Wait. Did I... already...
No... I...I still haven't...
Thank you.
A piece of cake!
Oh! He's awake! He's awake!
I just... need a little rest. I'm alright.
Just focus on recovering first. You can leave once you're back on your feet.
I remember the sky was gray when I left the supermarket. It was raining. Then... I haven't seen daylight since.
The TV had no sound. The phone wouldn't connect. The road outside the window was... I keep trying to go home, every day. But why...

Channeling her Forte, Chisa clips space to pull all of you safely back to Shashou Cafe. Just as it seems the immediate crisis has passed, the young Left Behind man you rescued vanishes before your eyes the moment he remembers the reason why he can never "go home."
Speaking of leads... do you know when the Fractsidus came to Honami?
The Fractsidus? You mean the ones in red we ran into just now?

So that's their name... Sorry, I wasn't familiar with it. It was my first time in that zone. I've mostly explored the port area. Still no confirmed route to the Tower, but at least we've ruled out several dead ends.
So there are other normal people in the city... I thought only the Red Cicadas in my hometown liked moving in swarms like that. Didn't expect to find another type like that here.
From what you said...
The Fractsidus must've been in Honami for at least two months.
And they've been running experiments here.
I can't decipher their methods from their files, but something's clearly wrong.
Our current priority is...
Find out what clues are in their basket.
We could start from the Commercial District. That's where I first arrived when I was pulled into this Sonoro. If we're lucky, something's still there.
Want to try this?
This is...
I scavenged it earlier. Some kind of fruit? Not sure if it suits your taste.
Ever since Honami fell under the Lament, food here became part of the Remnant Energy. Living things in this Sonoro no longer feel hunger... but to me, that's dangerous in itself.
...I don't want to go numb.
I don't want to get used to people disappearing into thin air. I don't want to get used to this loop. I have someone to find. Things to do... and a place to return to.
You feel the same, right?
Yeah, so we will leave here together.
I will break this deadlock.
Our goals align. I don't care how impenetrable the Tower is, I'll cut a way right into it.
No matter how tight this cage is, I'll tear it down.
The more Longings we collect, the more leads we have. I trust that day will come.
Sure, but...
But tonight, we can take it easy.
No <te href=851066>Irideglow</te>. No Lament. Just Honami, a quiet city at night.
Thanks for sharing this late-night snack with me... even if it's just canned fruit.
But still, thank you. See you tomorrow.
Chisa.
Oh, good evening.
…Comparing them to the Red Cicadas might be rude. An invalid analogy too, forget it. Sorry.
Space in Honami is already shattered glass. Anything too forceful could make the entire city collapse. These are hardly ideal conditions for experiments.
I think... they must've discovered something.
Maybe a clue about the Tower. Or some secret of the Lament, hidden in this Sonoro. Something so important, they're willing to take the risk of their experimental site crumbling.
We're not the only ones looking for a way out. They might already be ahead of us.

That night, you and Chisa rest on a bench outside the cafe. She confides in you her refusal to grow numb and indifferent to the loop of life and death in the city. Together, you will find a way to tear this cage apart.
Here we are.
I first ended up in this place two months ago. It wasn't during a Lament occurrence, so I had a bit of time to explore the city.
Do you still remember what happened?
Vaguely. But I do recall the first occurrence hit three days later.

At that time, Irideglow bled through the cracks in the gray sky, like the world had been sliced open by an invisible pair of scissors. People, buildings, even space itself… everything fell into chaos.
Then we need to recreate the city as it was before the Lament to uncover what really happened…
Who's there?!
Ahem. Sharp as a tack, you two.
Since you've caught on, the game is afoot. Listen up, young folks! This district is full of secrets!
I've been staking out this area for three days, five hours, and... well, a long time! And guess what? I've spotted something really fishy!
Those red coats sneaking around and tinkering every day... Mark my words, they're up to no good!
Red coats...? Could it be the Fractsidus?
So, what do you say? Care to join my Super Detective Team and hunt for the truth?
Super detective team.. and hunt for the truth?
Exactly! Just follow me. We're two clues away from cracking this wide open!

The next day, you go to where Chisa first landed in Honami City two months ago. There, you have an unexpected encounter with the detective capybara, Polmes. It claims to have spotted suspicious activity and asks you to investigate.
Well, well, you seem quite familiar with this place, young lady.
Naturally. That's basic detective work... Wait, over there! That's it!
So do you.
The Fractsidus must have left this device here.
But... it's inactive. Something's covering it.
Irideglow Crystals. We need to clear them off first.
"Expand the existing Sonoro Sphere"... Could that really be their goal?
It looks like they failed judging from this report.
...This is absurd.
If the Sonoro could be controlled, then why... why hasn't this loop been broken? The Left Behind are still trapped in this false memory of peace.

Controlling it can't be their objective. They're using it. Seeing if each Lament occurence is slower or the deaths more orderly... It's like throwing people into the fire just to test the temperature.
By Jove! My instincts were right! They are up to something shady!
These should be the Fractsidus's experimental devices.
Is that a research report?
(Pick up the research report)
Huh, first time seeing a report like this. "Lament Residue"… could that be those iridescent things we just saw?
Hmm? Why so quiet, all of you?
There might be more clues in other test sites.
That's right! There's another one close by! This way!

You uncover a Fractsidus research report shedding light on their actions in Honami City. It all points to the chilling goal of expanding this Sonoro Sphere and ultimately establishing control over it.
By the way, I didn't expect you to see through my disguise... Keen eyes like yours make you perfect candidates for my Super Detective Team!
And what exactly does this team do?
Why, investigate those red-coated troublemakers, of course! But come to think of it, I haven't seen them around lately. Suspicious...
May I ask how many members are on this team now?
...Just the one capybara.
Ahem! Anyway, we've arrived!
The plot thickens... this one's almost identical to the last report.
Same sequence number... but different data.
So they've been running the same experiment repeatedly, with different results each time.
But... why are they both labeled as No. 20?
Another report. Just as we expected.
(Pick up the research report)

Another report you find bears the exact same sequence number as the previous one, but its recorded data is different. This means the Fractsidus has been conducting the same experiment repeatedly, yet labeling every iteration as "No. 20."
Good morning, Goshujin-sama! Did you have a good rest?
Not bad.
Still a bit tired...
Your breakfast. Please enjoy.
Thank you.
Were you... cleaning?
Yes, yes! It's such a nice day today, so Chisa went out scavenging for supplies. We wanted to do our part too... so we started tidying up!
Once we're done, maybe there'll be space for a few new decorations? Hmm... It might be a nice surprise for Chisa! Passenger, do you have any ideas?
I'm not exactly an expert in interior design...
I'll give it a try!
Wonderful! This way, if you please!
Good morning. I'm back. Want something to eat? I picked up a few snacks from the store. Figured it'd be good to have some variety.
Thank you.
…Didn't expect the cafe to be this clean. For a moment, I thought I walked into the wrong place.
But it looks nice. Really lifts the mood. Thank you, all of you.
Well now, are you ready to go?
Let's go.
What's wrong?
...Nothing. Just thinking about a friend.
The one you mentioned before?
Yes. I'm sorry, I forgot to tell you her name. It's Sumika.
This is where I first met her, where our old base was. I left after the Lament sliced and stitched this place over and over… and I never returned.
I want to go back. To see if there's anything we missed.
I'll go with you.
Thank you. For accompanying me.
Sure. We do need more leads.
Ooo!
Zoning out, Detective?
Are you coming with us, Detective?
I-I'm deep in deduction! Still need more clues to uncover what those red-coated rascals are really after.
Hmm, your invitation is appreciated, but a good detective never leaves a case unsolved. I still need more clues to uncover what those red-coated rascals are really after.
I'll take my leave now. It's been a pleasure working with two sharp tools like you. Until next time!
Well then...
Let's go.

Back then, Sumika used to tease me. She'd say I had to map everything out—routes, terrain, vantage points, exits and entrances. All of it. But she… always went with her gut. Terrible sense of direction, though.
Even so, she chose to go to that tower alone.

Chisa recalls that she and her friend Sumika once made a building here their old base. Believing the old hideout might still hold overlooked clues, you decide to investigate and part ways with Polmes for the time being.
A stash of old science magazines with notes scribbled on a few pages.
I found some too. Must've been Sumika's. She used to read here during her downtime.
What about you?
I'd be with her. Sometimes we'd read the same thing.
But most of the time, I'd be maintaining my weapon.
That stash in the corner... they're all clocks.

There used to be more. Sumika collected them, placing them all across the city before the Lament struck. Then she went back to retrieve them one by one. It was pure madness... but it proved her theory.
The closer you get to Neon Tower, the slower time moves. In other words, all of Honami City might be lagging behind the outside world.
Remember that moss-covered watch? That's what first made Sumika notice something was off about this city.
Sumika mentioned the strange flow of time here.
The plants grow like everything's normal, yet those who died remain trapped in this loop. It's like something very powerful is holding them back.
Look. More amber behind us. This piece looks like it was created recently.
Is this a piece of amber?
Sumika left it here.
Her Forte allows her to create amber that stores memories or moments in time.
Memories or moments...
Yes. Just hold it like this...
…And you'll see what's been preserved inside.
She told me that time within this Sonoro moves slower than it does outside.
What's holding them back might just be their unfulfilled Longings.
They awakened Namipon to a city that still needs him.
Go on. Hold it like you did before.
Inside the old base, you discover ambers formed from Sumika's Forte. As you and Chisa connect with them, you see moments Sumika chose to record.
Judging from her notes, she really did make it to Neon Tower.
We need to find a way there. The sooner, the better.
Let's return to the cafe first. We'll need to check with Namipon and see if the Longings we've gathered are enough to guide us to the Tower.
Inside the Error Cell, Shorekeeper isolates a hidden message embedded in the abnormal frequency from the chaotic data streams—a set of shifting spatial coordinates.
You have come.
How's it going?
Any luck tracking the frequency?

This marks the Tethys System's first large-scale expansion of its frequency feature library. We needed to deploy it while it's still under validation. The data stream is immense, and I need more time. However...
...Within the chaos, I found a fragmented message.
A fragmented message?
Yes. The source identity is unclear, but we have isolated a set of constantly shifting spatial coordinates.
One points to an unknown location. The other... points here, to the Black Shores.
Whoever left that message knew exactly where to find the Black Shores. And if they do…
I'll check it out.
Understood. I will send the coordinates to your Terminal. I must remain here to continue isolating and tracing embedded messages in the surrounding frequencies. I entrust this to you, my star.
Actually… after reading Sumika's notes, I noticed something we might have missed.
What is it?
The Lament we're experiencing here in Honami... it doesn't feel like the real thing. It's weaker, like the power is fading...
Welcome back, dear Passengers!
If we want real answers, we'll need to reach the Lament's source... inside Neon Tower.
Would you like a cup of Coconut Cheese Latte made by yours truly? It's called Cloudy Coconut Sea.
At the very least, we can now confirm this is tied to the Fractsidus's Controllable Sonoro Project.
Hello? Heelllloooo?
…Ah. Sorry. Didn't mean to ignore you. We got a little distracted.
It's okay. I'm used to it.
By the way, Passenger... there's something I need to tell you.
I sensed a frequency that's closely connected to you. It's not from this space, but... it's calling for you.
Connected to me?
Not in this space?
Correct. It's beyond Honami City. Mm, part of it resonates from within you, but… it's not your frequency. What could it be?
Within me...
Abby?!
Who's Abby?
An Echo companion.
My friend.
I see... I haven't seen it before.
Abby is being blocked by this Sonoro.
Maybe it's looking for you, just like Namipon said.
Hmm... If you're in a hurry to meet it, I can try recalibrating Neon Tower's coordinates. But it'll take a little more time. Please wait patiently.
You seem concerned about this Abby, Passenger.
Because Abby is important to me.
Mhm, I can feel it too. Don't worry. I'll do my best.
So please, get some rest... for those who care about you.
Do you... want to take a breather on the terrace?
Sure.
Don't worry, Passenger. I'll do my best.
Maybe later.
Okay. Whenever you're available.
Is it... coming from the outside? Is the connection between this Sonoro and the outside world growing stronger?
But this space should be completely sealed off... unless the restraints around this Sonoro are weakening. Could it be... because of the Longings we gathered?

Back at the cafe, Namipon senses a frequency calling out for you. It's not of this space, but emanating from within you. You realize it must be Abby. Could this mean the restraints around this Sonoro Sphere are beginning to weaken?

Determined, Namipon begins sifting through the collected Longings to chart a route toward Neon Tower. While you wait for the results, Chisa invites you to join her for a breather on the cafe's terrace.
After leaving the Error Cell, you encounter Buling, who has also sensed the abnormal frequency. Using her Forte, she helps pinpoint the exact location of the shifting coordinates.
This is bad, really bad! Just look at my Casket of Fate! It's been rattling nonstop all day! All day! I haven't seen it this jumpy in years!
Didn't expect to run into you here.
I know, right? Thought I'd come back to do some quick biz... You know, fix up the feng shui, zing up some romance luck for the lonely hearts... But wah, this one is a big, big problem.
The voices won't stop pouring in. Feels like a whole swarm of abnormal frequencies gathering up. And look! My Pendant of Shifting Yao's so hot, I could fry an egg on it!
You've sensed that abnormal frequency too?
Delicate threads, twisted webs. A deadlock. It's trapped in a formation... It shouldn't even exist in this world.
Got any leads, Boss? Maybe I can help crack this one too.
Actually... I've got a pair of shifting spatial coordinates.
Oh really? Show me! I can try to track them down.

Ms. Buling, we understand your concern. But the Tethys System hasn't completed its analysis yet, and your talisman divination isn't always—Ahem, what I mean is, without proper clearance, we can't initiate a high-level response...

You trust those wires over me? I dreamed last night of three upside-down houses right outside my window. That's a horrible omen! And I felt Yin energy. That means something living is behind it. It's not an ordinary frequency, okay?!
It's not that we don't trust you, Ms. Buling. It's just... last time, when you dreamed of a black cat dancing ritualistically, it turned out your Casket just had water in it.
We'll begin parallel observation once Tethys completes its full spectrum diagnostics. It's for everyone's safety here in the Black Shores...
Aiya... by the time you're done crunching the data, even the immortals will be too old to—Oh! Boss! Didn't see you there!
Nice weather today. Rare to see a sunset like this. If Sumika were here, she'd probably capture this moment in one of her ambers.
Because it's beautiful?
Looking at it does take a weight off.
See that child by the signpost?
That's the seventh time I've seen him fall there.
The cashier keeps wiping a stain that isn't there... The walls are barely standing, but her uniform is spotless... just like it was.
The vending machine is due for restocking. With soda bottles that are already decades old.
That cat has been lying there for two months... maybe longer. I've only known it for two.

Middle school students are still taking photos of the sky after class, one that is now torn apart by Resonance Cords. But in their eyes, it's still clouds. Birds. Rainbows... the perfect sky of that single day.
The store keeps playing pop songs from the last century. The window that never shut all the way is still stuck at the notch it was left on years ago.
They've all been left behind in the past.
As for me... I'm starting to forget what day it is today.
This kind of life almost feels like...
An anime episode that got cut halfway?
A unsaved file?
Feels like what?
…Heh. Interesting analogy. When I was little, every summer break was spent with cool fans, watermelons, and an old TV. I loved watching anime and was always curious about those... special worlds.

…Heh. Interesting analogy. When I was little, I once lost an entire holiday's worth of homework I'd worked really hard on. My parents and teachers didn't scold me, but I still felt terrible about it for a long time... Now I always save my work the second I finish it.
I think it's kind of like... an unanswered call.
My parents were always busy. Whenever I missed them, I'd try calling... but most of the time, they couldn't answer. Even when they did, we never had much to say.
Do you miss them?
I can't say we're very close.
...It's not that I hate them. Things were just... ordinary. They had their jobs, I had school. We hardly spent time together.
But... sometimes, I do miss them. Just a little.
That's why you have to leave here.
You need to get back to keep living your life.
I really... really want to end this vicious loop.
I've already tried so many times, but the outcome is always the same...
But you still haven't stopped trying.
Every time the Lament struck, you moved toward Neon Tower, against the tide of fleeing citizens, knowing full well it was the most dangerous place to be.
You knew you couldn't save those who were already "gone," and still, you reached out. To the mother and daughter. To the injured young man. To me, when I first fell into this city.
You knew that in this endless loop, saving someone didn't change a thing. But still, not once did you ignore a cry for help. So...
Which means there's a chance to break it completely. I'm willing to put my faith in you. Let's seize that chance together.
Why would you...
Because we're partners. Isn't it only natural for me to trust you?
Chisa—! Passenger—!
I-I just confirmed Neon Tower's coordinates!
In my hometown, Resonators aren't really accepted. Someone who can't control their abilities is like a ticking time bomb... feared and resented.
I didn't want my parents to suffer because of me. So I thought... maybe if I stayed away, they wouldn't have to deal with the looks. Or the whispers.
After I became a Resonator and was placed under supervision, those chances became even rarer. I think the things people said about me ended up putting a lot of pressure on them, too.
No. To investigate what could possibly cause a sunset so unusual...
So you appeared.
At a time no one should have. In the most dangerous place. Beneath the Lament's shadow. It wasn't luck or coincidence.
The Sonoro isn't fully sealed anymore. Sumika cracked it open. And from the moment we met, the loop had already begun to loosen.

You follow Chisa up to the cafe's terrace. The setting sun bathes the ruined city in a warm glow. You both lean against the railing, watching the Irideglow slice and stitch the cityscape in an endless cycle. In this quiet moment, Chisa opens up about her past for the first time.
Whew… The way to Neon Tower is in disarray, but lucky us! We've got this!
Press this... and that should do it!
Now we have a route to the Tower's base. Once you're all set, we can move out!
To the Tower we go! Are you ready, Passenger?
Ready as ever.
I need time to prepare.
Over here! Over here! Yup, right there!
The big tall Tower, hiding in the broken city... it's finally opened up for us! Let's gooo!
(Coughing)
(Coughing) So much dust!
So much rubble from the city scattered in here... debris and loose junk. Watch your step, everyone.
We need to bypass all this and find a way to get to the top...
If Sumika really made it this far, she would have left a sign for me to follow.
Sumika might have taken this path straight ahead.
Let's go check it out.
Look! A shiny stone!
...It's Sumika's amber.
Whoa, this is...
The Fractsidus referred to these as Light Irideglow Crystals in their reports. Might be Lament residue.
Just like before, we should be able to clear them out to restore the area.
Sumika said her body was getting colder...
It is unusually cold here. There's a strange sensation of warmth being pulled away.
Yup... my bones are starting to shake!
Whatever is causing it, we need to stay sharp.
More Irideglow Crystals here!
Let's clear them off. Sumika's notes might have been buried beneath.
She said the path ahead is wrong...
We need to go back!
Hey, wait... w-wait for me... I'm freezing out here... Brrr...
This is it... Sumika's amber.
(Pick up the amber and hold it in your palm)
Look at those chairs.
They're covered in Irideglow Crystals too… Sumika's notes must be hidden underneath.
Whoa... look how big! And that tree!
Sumika... She marked every correct path. That's an amazing deed.
What's... that sound? Am I just... hearing things?
Are those... people from the Black Shores?
Hey! You... Can you see this "entrance"?
Please... help the people here... They're trapped...
My friend... she's trapped here...
Please...
Just once...
Let me win.
Ahh... what an incredible girl.
She got so close to finding the source of the Lament in the city. But as long as someone keeps going where she left off, she wouldn't have regretted it. Not once did she live with regret.
Did you hear that?
Argh... Sounds like the space inside the tower is being sliced up.
How did we miss it? Is it because the Lament here is different from the one outside?
Or maybe, the Tower itself has already been consumed by the Lament and has become a part of it.
{PlayerName}, Namipon. Take my hand.
A-aachoo! O-okay, Chisa!
Huh?
Aaaaahhhhh—

From Sumika's amber, you witness her final moments. Barely clinging to life, Sumika reaches a trembling hand toward a rift torn open by the Lament. Her last hope is that someone will find this city, break the tragic loop, and free her friend.
You...
GET… OUT—!
Take your cursed, bloated luxury of time—!
Don't touch our cocoon... Woven for ██ years…
Buried here… is our home…
GET OUT—
GET OUUUUUT——!!
One hour ago.
(This is...)
(Another space sliced apart by the Lament?)
(They're... not here?)
A mirage from nowhere, a shadow of ruins... Just looking at it sends a chill through me.
{PlayerName}, there's something I want to tell you. But... maybe I'm just imagining things.
What did you find?
That city... looks just like my hometown. The one swallowed by the Lament. I sensed a familiar frequency from it...
I've been away a long time. My memory could be wrong. But when facing the unknown, even the smallest thread might lead somewhere.
Maybe it once... really existed.
What is that?!
A city... submerged underwater?!
But... it looks like it's been completely destroyed...
The world's flipped. Rivers run backward. The sun and moon fall out of sync. The jade Buddha lowers his gaze—Boss, that is not a good sign.
That is...
After Buling pinpoints the location, a strange mirage of a city suddenly materializes over the waters near the Black Shores Archipelago.
Oh, is she the transfer student?
Probably. Heard she's a supervised Resonator... Better keep our distance...
That explains it... Look at that thing on her neck...
Why is she wearing that? Creepy... is it because she hurt someone?
Definitely. Just look at her... she's terrifying...
What are you doing, Kuchiba Chisa! Just introduce yourself!
This is... <ano=Train Conductor>Shashou</ano> Cafe.
Chisa!
You...
Chisa! Chisa! Thank you so much!
Thank... me? For what?
Heh, you forgot already? For helping me with my homework, of course! You're a genius! No one else in the class could've solved that tough equation but you!
I was so wrong about you before! Please don't be mad at me, okay? Can we still be friends, Chisa?
Hehe, I just knew you'd forgive me! You're always so kind, Chisa. So sweet, so bright... Honestly, you're like, the bestest ever!
(Yes. All of you are... my friends.)
Chisa, you're here! Thank you for saving us!
Saving you...? That isn't right, I-I didn't...
Chisa, stop being so modest! We wouldn't be here if it weren't for you. We all owe you so much. You're our savior!
We're all here enjoying life in the cafe because of you, Chisa. We can't imagine this place without you!
R-Really? Did I… actually help you all?
Of course! Don't you remember? Look over there—see those teachers and students? We're all here because of you...
Look at everyone's smiles. It's all because of you. Without you, this place would be cold and empty again, right?
Come to see everyone, Chisa. We all like you so much...
Everyone needs you... Please, we want you to stay with us...
A life like this feels great, doesn't it? To be loved, to be needed... Could you really give that up?
Why won't you come over, Chisa?
Why won't you come over, Chisa?
No... don't go...
Stop...
Don't go...
DON'T GO!
No... don't go...
Stop...
Don't go...
CHISA! COME BACK!
No... don't go...
Stop...
Don't go...
TURN AROUND AND HOLD MY HAND!
I've never seen anything like it. But that city... it's nothing but ruins now.
{PlayerName}, do you think it's a projection of the past or the future?
Are you alright, Chisa? Do you feel better now?
If you start feeling Overclocking symptoms, you should tell me.
Don't worry. I've installed an Overclocking detector in your collar. If anything goes wrong, we'll know immediately.
There's nothing to be afraid of...
Just enjoy every moment of your student life here.
We've always seen you as someone we can really count on. You should believe in yourself more, too.
Since we ended up here together, that makes us partners... even friends!
Didn't we promise to chase the stars? To go where the torch of truth burns bright—
This power was always yours. We only gave you the choice—to step into the stars, to seek the truth, and to protect the ones around you.
Welcome to Startorch Academy, Miss Kuchiba Chisa.
There you are! Heh, so this is where you've been hiding from us these last few days!
Don't shut us out, Chisa. We know you Overclocked, but that doesn't change anything. You'd never hurt us, we know that!
Yeah! We were super worried when you ran off like that.
There has to be a way to treat your condition. Maybe we can ask the instructors at the Academy?
I'll go with you!
How does it feel now? Any discomfort?
You see, Chisa, you can take it off whenever you want. It won't bind you anymore. And it never should have.
You're a bright, remarkable child. I believe you'll reach the farthest stars together with your companions.
Why would you... trust me?
Because we're partners.
Isn't it only natural for me to trust you?
You're Chisa. Of course you can do this!
There's nothing you can't overcome.
You carry a strength deeper than anyone's, Chisa. Even if you fall ten thousand times, you'll still find the courage to rise again. You just haven't realized it yet.
We're gonna go so far together, just wait and see!
Don't give up, Chisa. We're all looking forward to the future you'll create.

Chisa gazes into the distance, memories of her time in Lahai-Roi surfacing before her eyes—the kind professors, the idealistic students, and the future they all vowed to fight for: a world free of the Lament. The light of Startorch has always burned eternally in her heart.
Chisa! Long time no see.
I'm going to... Take care of yourself while I'm gone.
If you ever find yourself in trouble, look for this person.
But even without a guide… I trust you'll still find your own tomorrow.
So... go run to it.
Nothing can trap you.
Nothing can trap me... I'll find my way back.
Even if I have to shatter myself a thousand times!
Hey! Chisa! Passenger! You're finally here! I-I've been stuck here for ages!
It's seriously dangerous here! That thing… it's right over there!
Are you alright?
I'm okay. Just got turned around when the space split.
Well then...
It's time to send it back.
I'm finally back!
Welcome back!
Mommy, what's that?
Time to clock out. I need a proper rest.
Look at this! I managed to buy the newest bread special!
Argh, I'll miss the last bus...
I'm home!
...Just glad you're back, Chisa.
Mmm, what a lovely ending.
Lantern lights glow warm, curtains sway in tea's sigh... And the boat comes home...
Dear Passengers, this... is as far as I go. We'll...
This is... the end of this story.
An ending that gently mirrors its beginning.
Come on over and try your father's new dish!
Coming! You know what, Mom? I tripped today...
...Just glad you're back.
Go home now.
By the way, about that anomaly... I made a new discovery!
Buildings closer to the tower in the central district...
Hmm... The way the second hand moves...
Ta-da! Superstar Namipon's here!
Your coffee's here! It's still hot and steaming...
Wherever you go, whenever it is, you'll always have a place with us.
Stay safe. Stay happy.
Why are you out here alone?
It's just… I still can't quite accept it.
I know they died a long time ago, and they were only Human Reverberations that the Sonoro created. But now they're all... gone.
You need time to accept that they're gone.
You need time to accept what's changed.
And Namipon... even though we were only together for two months, every time I came back to the cafe... it was always there, waiting for me.
No choice, I have to face it... Let's go.

Thanks to your efforts, the Left Behind have finally found their way "home." But with the mission ended and Namipon vanishing, a piercing loneliness overwhelms Chisa. You find her sitting alone on a bench in the park outside the cafe.

A mysterious spatial rift appears, leading to an unknown Sonoro Sphere. Researchers from the Black Shores quickly assemble a makeshift observation platform nearby. You want to enter the rift, but Buling can't shake a sense of dread.
Great, {PlayerName}, you're here!
Here I am.
How's everything going?
Good. Let me give you a quick briefing on what we've learned so far. This spatial rift leads to an unknown Sonoro Sphere.
Some Bloom Bearers attempted to enter for investigation, but... the rift appears to resist all forms of entry and interference.
As far as we know, this spatial rift leads to an unknown Sonoro Sphere. Some Bloom Bearers attempted to enter for investigation, but... the rift appears to resist all forms of entry and interference.
The mirage we're seeing is a projection leaking from the Sonoro into reality.
(The researcher from earlier said it might have been a real city...)
(But if that's true, why is it being projected into the rift? And why were its coordinates sent to the Black Shores?)
Hey, Boss! You zoned out again. Still thinking about the creepy rift, huh?
...Something about this isn't normal.
The frequency data sent to the Black Shores, the coordinates pointing to this rift, this Sonoro of a ruined city... It's hard to make sense of the info we have. If only we could enter it ourselves...
Would've been nice, huh? But this thing's got its doors shut tight to outsiders. But you {PlayerName}, you might be different! You're always full of surprises.
Still, are you sure you want to? I've "seen" it... That's a Death Gate, clear as day.
(Maybe I should try using the power of separation? I might be able to split the projection from the rift...)
Sunlight through the glass, sugar cubes crackle in sun, the scent of tea drifts—Hey! No snatching, no snatching!
...What... How are you—?!
Hm? I'm brewing tea for you.
But you said... "this is as far as I go"?
Uh... yes. It was as far as I could go because I had to go back to the cafe first...
It just… took a bit longer to finish that sentence.
Wh-what's wrong?
Nothing... forget it.
I'm just... glad you're back.
What's your plan next?
There's something I need to finish. But...
But before that, you need to handle something personal?
Now can you finally tell me?
Always so reserved, Chisa. I'll say it for you, then—
My Overclocking symptoms are—
My Overclocking symptoms... they're not fully resolved. Inside this Sonoro, things are stable. But once I leave... I don't know if it'll spiral out of control.
Still... even if I do Overclock, I wouldn't just attack someone. Sumika once mentioned she had some friends, researchers, who might be able to treat me. But... but I...
I happen to know her friends.
Do want to try trusting me now?
...Huh?
Come to the Black Shores with me.
To the place where Sumika once lived and worked. To where a new beginning awaits.
What I said earlier… wasn't quite right. This is the real ending.
Mm. So wholesome.
Ah, Passengers! You're back!
Now… it's time to take that step toward a new beginning.
Wait... that's...

You return to the cafe to find Namipon in a lively tussle with its companions over a plate of snacks—it hadn't disappeared after all!

With one story concluded, a new journey awaits. At your invitation, Chisa agrees to travel with you back to the Black Shores, to see the place where Sumika once lived and worked… and to step into a new beginning.
Hm? I smell something special...
